intro: Helicteres rhynchocarpa, commonly known as the beakfruit or roundleaf beakfruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a distinctive, elongated capsule that resembles a beak, hence its common name. The plant is notable for its ornamental value and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
